intro: Lychnis sylvestris, commonly known as wood cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers bloom from June to August. Lychnis sylvestris is also known for its ability to thrive in partial shade and its value as a nectar source for pollinators.
